https://news.gallup.com/poll/654905/amer: Gallup News: Nearly all Americans use AI-powered products without realizing it, with two-thirds unaware of AI's presence.
https://www.pewresearch.org/science/2025: Pew Research indicates that 50% of Americans are more concerned than excited about the increased use of AI in daily life, a rise from 37% in 2021.
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/29/opini: Opinion piece discussing how even basic AI use can be detrimental to students' fundamental skills like reading comprehension.
https://www.apa.org/topics/artificial-in: American Psychological Association (APA) health advisory on artificial intelligence and adolescent well-being, offering recommendations for safety.
https://menlovc.com/perspective/2025-the: Menlo Ventures report on '2025: The State of Consumer AI' highlights that 61% of American adults have used AI in the past six months, with nearly one in five using it daily, indicating a consumer tipping point and a rapidly growing market.
https://www.foxbusiness.com/technology/a: A recent poll indicates 11% of people use AI daily, while tech giants are issuing warnings about the profound risks associated with the AI boom reshaping daily life.
https://hai.stanford.edu/ai-index/2025-a: The 2025 AI Index Report highlights AI's rapid move from lab to daily life, with 223 AI-enabled medical devices approved by the FDA in 2023.
https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/202: Pew Research Center report on expert and public views regarding the risks, opportunities, and regulation of AI, highlighting differences in excitement, worries, and predictions about AI surpassing human capabilities.
https://www.brookings.edu/articles/how-a: This 2018 Brookings article discusses how AI is transforming various sectors like finance, national security, healthcare, criminal justice, transportation, and smart cities. It also addresses key issues such as data access, algorithmic bias, AI ethics, transparency, and legal liability. While foundational, its publication date means it may not cover the latest advancements.
https://www.norc.org/research/library/wh: A study reveals that 51% of Americans do not use AI for personal activities, with only 14% reporting daily use, indicating a significant portion of the population is not actively engaging with AI.
https://safe.ai/ai-risk: Research identifies four catastrophic AI risks: malicious use, AI races, organizational risks, and the emergence of rogue AI.
https://www.online.uc.edu/blog/artificia: UC Online discusses 9 benefits of AI, highlighting its transformative impact across industries like healthcare, finance, agriculture, and cybersecurity, driving innovation and efficiency.
https://www.pewresearch.org/science/2025: Pew Research Center's report on AI in Americans' lives reveals that one-third of adults under 30 interact with AI multiple times a day, indicating a significant increase in everyday AI integration and public awareness.
https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-rel: U.S. Treasury report on the uses, opportunities, and risks of AI, with a focus on cybersecurity risks in the financial sector.
https://www.ibm.com/think/insights/10-ai: IBM: Details 10 dangers and risks of AI, along with strategies for risk management.
https://www.csis.org/analysis/navigating: AI poses a risk by potentially increasing the gatekeeper power of search engines and social media platforms over digital news outlets.
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2: A new study warns of a 'devastating impact' on online news audiences as AI summaries increasingly replace traditional search results.
https://blog.google/technology/ai/google: Google introduced Gemini for Home and vibe coding in AI Studio in October 2025, aiming to simplify AI app development and integrate AI more naturally into daily life. Vibe coding allows users to build AI-powered apps by describing them in everyday language, eliminating the need to manage API keys and connect models.
https://www.reuters.com/technology/artif: Adobe has begun publicly distributing an AI model capable of generating video from text prompts. This development positions Adobe as a key player in the growing field of AI-powered content creation, making advanced video generation tools more accessible.

AIREC robots are being developed to assist with nursing tasks in Japan, such as helping individuals sit up, put on socks, cook, and fold laundry. This initiative aims to address the challenges posed by Japan's ageing population by integrating AI into daily care routines.

Papa John's International is expanding its partnership with Google to integrate artificial intelligence technology into its pizza ordering process. This aims to transform how customers order pizza, making the experience more efficient and user-friendly through AI.
https://cloud.google.com/transform/101-r: Google Cloud details 101 real-world generative AI use cases from industry leaders, showcasing how AI is improving data access, eliminating manual tasks, and increasing delivery efficiency in various businesses.
https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2025: The New York Times reports on 21 ways people are using AI at work, including chefs inventing recipes, doctors reading scans, and scientists making discoveries.
https://www.oneusefulthing.org/p/using-a: Ethan Mollick's guide, 'Using AI Right Now,' offers practical examples of how AI can be used in real-time for tasks like identifying plants, solving problems, and getting cooking tips.
https://theconversation.com/ai-chatbots-: AI chatbots are increasingly being used as everyday tools for mundane tasks, according to recent use data.
